Comment: I can understand why the Western banks decided the man was radioactive.   Even if you look past the personality, the numbers don't lie, and a man who has a tendency to declare his businesses bankrupt and leave his creditors holding the can is not who you want as a client.  I can even understand why Russia's okay with that.  If you're looking to launder money, who cares if the businesses you invest in fail from time to time?  As long as you get get a good chunk back from what you put in, you're happy - any business that by some miracle turns a profit is a bonus.  But no business can function without a lot of other people and other organisations.  And who in their right mind wants to work with a man who wants to renegotiate everything every twenty minutes?
Author: jimicus
